answers.answer: Congats on your little one and sorry to hear about your Gran.
Congrats on your new baby - that's great that the birthing experience went so well for you!  I'm sorry about your grandmother - it truely shows the circle of life!
I am very sorry to hear about your grandmother. Congrats on your new little man!
Congratulations on the birth of your son!    I'm sorry to hear about your grandmother- she definately know about your sons birth and will be watching over you.
Oh Lynne, congrats on the new little man! I want to see pictures!! I am so sorry about your Grandma and that you can't go to the service.
Congratulations on the birth of Lukas!  Because I believe in God and Heaven, I know your Grandma can see Lukas perfectly and is with you both.

Congrats! That snuck up on me fast! I am so happy for you, and I love the name you chose. Very classy.I am sorry to hear about your Grandma. My heart goes out to you.I can't wait to see pics of the little guy :)

Thanks everyone!  He had his first checkup today.  He is now 7lb 5 oz but is doing great.  He sleeps alot and is a little piggy.  If anyone would like to see him go to www.Our365.com.  My customer number is 02783-2700-92936 and last name is Burchfield.  That is the information they said you would need.  I got an email and just clicked on the link so I haven't tried it this way.
congrats! I also love the name, and think it goes very well with Ayden :)

Lynne! Sorry I'm so late getting here! Congratulations on your little man though! I'm waiting on the site to load right now to see his pictures. :) What does Ayden think about this big brother business? I'll bet Cyrus is probably a big help now that he's a tad older, too!Sorry about your Grandma! :( I'm sure she's in heaven smiling down on you and your beautiful boys though.Take care of yourself and those little guys!

Jess, Ayden loves him!   He is always walking up to him and giving him kisses and petting him when he cries.  He hasn't shown any jealousy so far.  Cyrus has been really good keeping Ayden entertained.  They are two peas in a pod to begin with.  I'm really happy about having three boys.  I hope they will all be close.Do you have a name picked out yet?

Aw! I'm glad they are all doing so well together! Hopefully Max will be the same way. He's pretty compassionate and loves babies, so I hope he likes his own! lol We're naming him Owen Gregory. Unless he's born looking more like an Alexander....then he's Alexander! We had a tough time deciding, but chose Owen because it's less popular than Alexander. We'll see though!
Just saw his photos! He DOES look like Ayden! Soooo cute!

question: Lukas arrived at a little over 37 weeks on Wed night at 11:58!  It was a bit of a surprise but a good one.  I woke up that morning with cramps.  I noticed that my plug was coming out and continued to all day so I figured it may be soon.  Then again people tell me they walk around like that for weeks so you never know.  My cramps got really bad so I called my doctor to see me instead of the hospital.  I didn't want to go for 6 hrs for them to send me home.  When he checked me I was 3-4 and said I needed to be a solid 4 to send me in labor for my c section.  He told me to walk around and come back in a couple hours.  I walked around downtown Disney (really bad idea since it was like 100 out) and went back.  No change so he sent me home with muscle relaxers and told me to take them and take a nap.  He said either I would wake up in pain and it would be true labor or it would all go away.  Needless to say I got home and fell asleep and didn't pick up my prescription.  When I woke up my cramps had gone away a bit.  An hour later I realized I hadn't felt him move at all since before my nap so I took and shower and told my husband I wanted to get checked.  On the way to the hospital my contractions came back.  I got there around 9pm and I was 4 cm!!!!!!!  Unfortunately my labor progressed quickly and I couldn't get anything for the pain until right before my section.  They were waiting on my platelet count to come back because I may have developed preeclampsia at that point and wanted to make sure my count was high enough before giving me a needle in my spine.  Finally at about 11:30 they took me back and he was born at 11:58.  He is (or was) 8lbs and 20 inches long.  He is perfect and looks just like Ayden.  He nurses like a champ and had no problems latching.  My mom wasn't planning on coming down until next Friday and my mother in law was away on business so it was just me and Matt.  Compared to my entire experience with Ayden my whole birthing experience this time was absolutely perfect from start to finish.  It was nice with just Matt and I.  This time all the nurses were wonderful and he went straight from the OR to recovery with me.  I didn't see Ayden for 8 hours after birth.  Last night my mother in law bought me a full body massage right in my room and my husband and I a four course gormet dinner.  Then I was discharged and out the door less than 48 hours after he was born.  I got home and my friend had cleaned and organized my entire house for me.  Yesterday was the best day ever!  Unfortunately shortly after Lukas was born I recieved a phone call that my grandmother had passed unexpectantly.  I was devestated.  I am closer to her than anyone I know.  I just wish she had found out about Lukas.  The services are Monday and Tuesday in Massachusetts so there is no way I can go.  I just have to believe that she is watching over him right now and maybe thats why he was born early.Sorry this is so long.  I just wanted to share with everyone!!
title: Lukas Matthew has arrived!!!!
